name: Caltech Canyon
description:
Caltech canyon is a subsidiary to Eaton flowing between Muir and Markham, directly across from Harvard Branch. Best January through June, before it drys up. Flash flood warning- narrow spots with no escape. It is more of an option for those who have already completed lower Eaton before.

Approach

1)Continue on Idlehour trail from Idlehour to Caltech canyon crossing *only if interested in the Idlehour trail above Eaton

2)Trace the canyon upward from the confluence with Eaton *most practical though strenuous

3)Rappel into the canyon from Mount Markham elev 3100(downhill of subpeak 3513)*best route To accomplish this scramble up the scree slope upstream of Idlehour camp above a small falls(not visible from trail).... and ending the scrambling at the right of the rock promotory of the slope.

Descent

8 drops, with 2 cascades less than 10ft, all but Calteach falls can be downclimbed. The tallest is Caltech canyon falls at 60ft(67 ft from anchor). This optional rap can be downclimbed DCR. All of the drops occur near the end of the canyon.

Exit

The canyon finishes yards downstream of Idlehour camp at Eaton creek. The exit time would likely be 1.5 hours to exit via the Eaton approach trail to the Conservation area where the shuttle car would be placed, or another 3-5 hours to exit via Lower Eaton Canyon.

Red tape

If Caltech is used as an alternate approach to descending Eaton, permits no longer required for the Eaton segment
